intro: Forsteronia mollis, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Forsteronia mollis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
